business.headline: Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.
Sensex, Nifty trade higher after flat start as banks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 232.01 points to 82,404.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 70.60 points to 25,252.40 as of 9:32 am.

UK PM Keir Starmer calls Paytm the 'Superstar' of Indian fintech industryUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that the rise of Indian fintech companies on the world stage driven by technological innovation, digital inclusion, and entrepreneurial scale.

LG Electronics IPO allotment live: Check status online, GMP surges ahead of listingLG Electronics IPO closed for bidding on Thursday, created a record by attracting bids worth Rs 4.4 lakh crore, making it the most subscribed IPO in India by value.

Tata Trusts board meets today amid internal turmoil: Here's what to expectThe board meeting follows days of internal disagreement and comes just a day after the first death anniversary of Ratan N. Tata, the former chairman who led the Trusts for several decades until his death last year.

Hidden in fine print: The clause that lets insurers quietly increase your premiumA little-known "Material Change" clause in health policies lets insurers increase premiums or restrict coverage after a claim. However, policyholders can challenge such actions to safeguard renewability and long-term benefits.

US sanctions over 50 entities, including Indians, over links to Iran oil tradeAmong those sanctioned are Varun Pula, Soniya Shrestha, and Iyappan Raja, all Indian nationals accused of facilitating shipments of Iranian oil and LPG.

7 alternative ways to diversify your portfolio this DiwaliAs Diwali approaches, many are thinking about not just celebrations but also financial planning. Diversifying your portfolio across multiple assets can help manage risk and make your money work harder in the long run.

entertainment.headline: Alia likely to join Prabhas's Kalki 2898 AD sequel after Deepika's exit: Report Actor Alia Bhatt is reportedly in advanced discussions to join the sequel of 'Kalki 2898 AD'. The makers had earlier cited creative and commitment differences for actor Deepika Padukone's exit from the film.

Varinder Ghuman suffered cardiac arrest after routine surgery, says hospital Punjabi actor and well-known bodybuilder Varinder Singh Ghuman died following a sudden cardiac arrest after a routine shoulder surgery in Amritsar. An official statement issued by the hospital confirmed Ghuman had no prior health issues.

Shilpa Shetty gives glimpse into star-studded Karwa Chauth celebration. Watch Actor Shilpa Shetty on Friday gave a glimpse into Karwa Chauth celebrations at Sunita Kapoor's home. Several well-known Bollywood personalities attended the festive event.

Wanted to be self-deprecating, not disrespectful: Aryan Khan on Ba***ds of Bollywood Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood', delivered a sharp yet respectful satire on the Hindi film industry. Speaking about the show's tone, the young filmmaker said the team was careful to keep the humour self-deprecating without ever crossing into disrespect.

Plan my honeymoon too: Trisha Krishnan shuts down marriage rumours with wit Trisha Krishnan addressed rumours about her marriage plans with wit and clarity, dismissing speculations of an impending wedding to a Chandigarh businessman. The actor shared a clever post on Instagram to hit back at those speculating.

Salman Khan pays heartfelt tribute to late Tiger 3 co-star Varinder Singh Ghuman Actor Varinder Singh Ghuman, India's first vegetarian professional bodybuilder and noted actor, died suddenly at 47 due to cardiac arrest. His 'Tiger 3' co-star Salman Khan mourned his death in an emotional post.

Boman Irani to young writers: Don't use learning as fodder for intellectualism Boman Irani mentored aspiring writers at the FICCI Frames 2025 event, emphasising excellence and resilience. He highlighted the need for new voices in Indian cinema and called for writers to secure fair credit and pay.

Disney revives live-action Tangled, Scarlett Johansson in talks for Mother Gothel Disney is revisiting the beloved tale of Rapunzel with a live-action remake of 'Tangled', eyeing Scarlett Johansson for the role of Mother Gothel. The project, now back in early development, reflects Disney's renewed confidence following the success of recent live-action adaptations.

Deepika Padukone appointed as India's first Mental Health Ambassador On World Mental Health Day, actor Deepika Padukone has been selected as the first mental health ambassador of India. Her appointment will help widely disseminate awareness about mental health issues in India.

Atlee on Rishab Shetty in Kantara Chapter 1: He deserves a National Award | Exclusive 'Jawan' director Atlee was all praise for Rishab Shetty's recent blockbuster 'Kantara Chapter 1'. In an exclusive chat, he revealed that he drove for two and a half hours in Amsterdam to catch the film on its first day.

Victoria Beckham review: Polished, poised, and perfectly controlledRelease Date:Fri Oct 10, 2025 Victoria Beckham docuseries review: Netflix's Victoria Beckham docuseries offers an intimate look at her career and family life. It highlights her calculated reinvention from pop star to fashion icon with style and control.

Sonu Sood comes to rescue of Punjab flood-affected family seeking medical aid Actor Sonu Sood has initiated medical treatment for a family he helped during the Punjab floods. His prompt action highlights his continued commitment to philanthropy and social welfare.

Before the Avengers there was Ben 10, the real multiverse trailblazer Celebrate Ben 10 Day with a nostalgic dive into our childhood's iconic multiverse hero. From the Omnitrix to timeless adventures, Ben 10 still reigns supreme.

Minecraft 2 movie in the works, slated for 2027 release: Reports Warner Bros announced 'Minecraft 2' with a release set for July 2027. The first film proved a box office hit, grossing USD 957 million globally.

Karan Johar clarifies stance on Homebound after remarks spark confusion Karan Johar addressed recent misunderstandings about his comments on the film 'Homebound.' He reaffirmed his pride in the film and clarified that his statements were about the business side of filmmaking, not a critique of the project.

The Summer I Turned Pretty S3 tops Prime Video charts with 70 million views 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' Season 3 reached 70 million viewers in 70 days. The series became Prime Video's most-watched show among women aged 18 to 34.

Orry and Rakhi Sawant's quirky airport reel is pure entertainment. Watch Orry's latest video with Rakhi Sawant has left fans in splits. The duo's camaraderie and fun at the airport have left the viewers asking for more such collaboration.

Bradley Cooper to join Margot Robbie for Ocean's Eleven prequel Bradley Cooper is set to star alongside Margot Robbie in a new prequel to the iconic 'Oceans Eleven'. Directed by Lee Isaac Chung, it is set in 1960s Europe.

general news.headline: I dedicate Nobel to Trump for backing our cause: Venezuela's Maria Corina MachadoVenezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado who won the Nobel Peace Prize 2025 and ended Donald Trump's dream of winning the prize, praised the US President for supporting the Venezuelans working to establish democracy and end President Nicolas Maduro's dictatorship.

Watch: How Nobel panel broke news to Maria Corina Machado and what she saidCatch the moment Maria Corina Machado learned she had won the Nobel Peace Prize — she was stunned, but all grace and humility.

Women journalists barred from Afghan minister's Delhi press conferenceAfghan Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi's Delhi press conference sparked outrage after no women journalists were invited, exposing the Taliban's continued gender bias, even on Indian soil. The exclusion drew sharp condemnation from journalists and politicians, who called it misogynistic and unacceptable.

They place politics over peace: White House after Trump snubbed for Nobel 2025US President Donald Trump has been vying for the Nobel Peace Prize and has long argued that he deserved one for "ending eight wars".

India helps build, Pakistan destroys AfghanistanIndia is giving MRI machines, CT scan machines, vaccines and  cancer medicines to help the people of Afghanistan. Pakistan has carried out air strikes across several provinces in Afghanistan.

India using Afghanistan as terror base: Rattled Pak cranks up lie machineIslamabad's military once again blames India and Afghanistan for Pakistan's own terror crisis, even as its ties with the Taliban regime reach breaking point.

Japan gripped by massive flu outbreak: Hospitals struggle, schools shutWith flu cases expected to peak sooner than usual, authorities are urging people, especially the elderly, young children, and those with pre-existing conditions, to get vaccinated immediately.

The only Hindu in Hamas's custodyBipin Joshi, who was working at a farm in southern Israel as part of a study programme, was among those kidnapped by Hamas during its offensive in Israel on October 7, 2023.

World's first veg bodybuilder's death sparks calls for heart screeningsEven the fittest young adults aren't immune to heart risks. Regular check-ups, awareness of warning signs, and responsible training are essential. Fitness alone doesn't guarantee a healthy heart; prioritise cardiac health alongside workouts.

Ground Boeing 787s: Pilots' body demands citing technical glitches, Air India reactsThe Federation of Indian Pilots has cited the continuous electrical problems and a special DGCA audit for Air India aircraft for maintenance.
Nobel Peace Prize snubs Trump, ends year's loudest, funniest spectacleThe self-proclaimed peacemaker's quest befuddled and amused the world, but the Nobel Committee didn't pay any attention.

China wants to hold whole world captive with rare earth export controls: TrumpUS President Donald Trump described China's move on export controls as a "sinister and hostile" effort to gain an economic monopoly,

Alia likely to join Prabhas's Kalki 2898 AD sequel after Deepika's exit: ReportActor Alia Bhatt is reportedly in advanced discussions to join the sequel of 'Kalki 2898 AD'. The makers had earlier cited creative and commitment differences for actor Deepika Padukone's exit from the film.

Don't test courage of Afghans: Taliban minister's warning to Pak from IndiaAfghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi, after meeting External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar in New Delhi, assured that Afghanistan will not allow its territory to be used against any country.

Deepika Padukone appointed as India's first Mental Health AmbassadorOn World Mental Health Day, actor Deepika Padukone has been selected as the first mental health ambassador of India. Her appointment will help widely disseminate awareness about mental health issues in India.

Marco Rubio's letter backing Maria Corina Machado surfaces after her Nobel winThe letter praised Maria Corina Machado for "risking everything to rally the previously flagging spirits of the Venezuelan people."

Wanted to be self-deprecating, not disrespectful: Aryan Khan on Ba***ds of BollywoodAryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood', delivered a sharp yet respectful satire on the Hindi film industry. Speaking about the show's tone, the young filmmaker said the team was careful to keep the humour self-deprecating without ever crossing into disrespect.
40 till they die: In this Bihar village, long life is an illusionStraight out of a dystopian movie, but hauntingly real – in Bihar's Doodh Paniya village, life rarely lasts beyond 40.

Period leave is official in Karnataka. But are men on board?Karnataka has made menstrual leave official, a move hailed as a step toward gender-sensitive workplaces. But how do men really feel about it?

Gaza ceasefire in effect, announces Israeli military; troops being relocatedThe ceasefire came into effect at noon Israel time (2.30 pm IST). The initial de-escalation is part of a 20-point peace plan proposed by US President Donald Trump.

He does a lot for peace: Putin reacts after Trump misses out on Nobel Peace PrizeVenezuelan opposition leader Maria Corino Machado won the Nobel Peace Prize 2025 for her fight for democratic rights in the South American country.

Was Aurangzeb India's true unifier?Pakistan minister Khawaja Asif said India was "never truly united except under Aurangzeb". Did the sixth Mughal emperor, under whom the dynasty reached the zenith of territorial dominance, indeed unify India? What's the historical fact?

Islamabad turns fortress amid Labbaik's US embassy march, 2 killed in violencePakistan's capital, Islamabad, remains tense after security personnel clashed with members of far-right outfit, Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan's (TLP) in Lahore. Lakhs of TLP men attempted to march to the US Embassy in Islamabad. Containers and barricades have been put up, and the internet has been shut. The violence in the protest-march for Palestine, which will continue on Friday, left two dead and dozens injured.

Why Nobel for Maria Machado is like rubbing salt into Trump's woundsBy honouring Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado with a peace prize, the Nobel Committee didn't just celebrate courage, it delivered a scathing message to US President Donald Trump. In choosing a woman who defends democracy over a man who undermines it, the committee reminded the world that peace prizes are earned by integrity and conviction, not bluster and self-promotion.

Alia likely to join Prabhas's Kalki 2898 AD sequel after Deepika's exit: ReportActor Alia Bhatt is reportedly in advanced discussions to join the sequel of 'Kalki 2898 AD'. The makers had earlier cited creative and commitment differences for actor Deepika Padukone's exit from the film.

Varinder Ghuman suffered cardiac arrest after routine surgery, says hospitalPunjabi actor and well-known bodybuilder Varinder Singh Ghuman died following a sudden cardiac arrest after a routine shoulder surgery in Amritsar. An official statement issued by the hospital confirmed Ghuman had no prior health issues.

sports.headline: Kasparov quips Anand's real challenge is managing India's chess children Garry Kasparov talked about Viswanathan Anand's influence on young Indian chess players. Anand's academy continues to nurture talent even as the rivalry heats up on the board.

NZ vs BAN: New Zealand finally get off the mark as Bangladesh capitulate in Guwahati An all-round bowling performance from New Zealand helped them get off the mark and thrash Bangladesh by 100 runs in the Women's World Cup 2025 on Friday, October 10. Devine continued to be impressive with the bat for the White Ferns and found support from Brooke Halliday.

Ravichandran Ashwin confirmed to play full Big Bash League season for Sydney Thunder Ravichandran Ashwin will play the entire Big Bash League season with Sydney Thunder after going unsold in the ILT20 auction. His full-season commitment boosts Thunder's title hopes and highlights his post-retirement cricket journey.

Sai Sudharsan is someone who's mentally tough, never under pressure: Sitanshu Kotak India's batting coach, Sitanshu Kotak, believes that Sai Sudharsan is a player who has the mental resilience and never comes to bat under pressure. This comes after his splendid knock against the West Indies in Delhi on Day 1.

The art of letting it go: How Sai Sudharsan broke the shackles in Test cricket Sai Sudharsan showcased patience and maturity in India's second Test against West Indies, building a 193-run stand with Yashasvi Jaiswal. Learning from past experiences, he reacted calmly, making a strong case for the number three spot.

Sanju Samson to play for Kerala vs Maharashtra in Ranji Trophy opener: Report India wicket-keeper Sanju Samson is all set to play for Kerala in their Ranji Trophy opener against Maharashtra, which will begin on October 15. Kerala have named Mohammed Azharudeen as their new captain.

Marufa Akter breaks down recalling dark times: Couldn't even afford new clothes Women's World Cup: Bangladesh pacer Marufa Akter said she overcame a childhood of financial struggles and social exclusion, and is now proud to make her mark on the international stage.

Won't play bad shots: Yashasvi Jaiswal's tea time message revealed by batting coach India batting coach Sithanshu Kothak heaped praise on Yashasvi Jaiswal and revealed the tea-time chat he had with the southpaw during Day one of the second Test against the West Indies. Jaiswal scored his 7th century on Friday, October 10.

Fans mock empty stands at Delhi Test, say Rohit's Mumbai training had bigger crowd The India–West Indies Test series continues to suffer from poor crowd attendance, with Delhi's stadium nearly empty on Day 1 of the second Test. Meanwhile, in Mumbai, Rohit Sharma drew hundreds of fans to his training session at the iconic Shivaji Park.

How England will look to tackle tricky Colombo pitch? Tammy Beaumont reveals Tammy Beaumont said that England have done their homework on the Colombo pitch and will be looking to implement their methods during the clash against Sri Lanka on Saturday, October 11.

India win historic bronze at BWF World Junior Team Championships 2025 India's campaign in the BWF World Junior Mixed Team Championships ended with a historic bronze, marking the country's first-ever podium finish in the mixed-team event after a semifinal loss to defending champions Indonesia.

Marufa Akter breaks down recalling dark times: Couldn't even afford new clothes Women's World Cup: Bangladesh pacer Marufa Akter said she overcame a childhood of financial struggles and social exclusion, and is now proud to make her mark on the international stage.

Won't play bad shots: Yashasvi Jaiswal's tea time message revealed by batting coach India batting coach Sithanshu Kothak heaped praise on Yashasvi Jaiswal and revealed the tea-time chat he had with the southpaw during Day one of the second Test against the West Indies. Jaiswal scored his 7th century on Friday, October 10.

Fans mock empty stands at Delhi Test, say Rohit's Mumbai training had bigger crowd The India–West Indies Test series continues to suffer from poor crowd attendance, with Delhi's stadium nearly empty on Day 1 of the second Test. Meanwhile, in Mumbai, Rohit Sharma drew hundreds of fans to his training session at the iconic Shivaji Park.

How England will look to tackle tricky Colombo pitch? Tammy Beaumont reveals Tammy Beaumont said that England have done their homework on the Colombo pitch and will be looking to implement their methods during the clash against Sri Lanka on Saturday, October 11.

India win historic bronze at BWF World Junior Team Championships 2025 India's campaign in the BWF World Junior Mixed Team Championships ended with a historic bronze, marking the country's first-ever podium finish in the mixed-team event after a semifinal loss to defending champions Indonesia.

Hungry Yashasvi Jaiswal feasts on West Indies as India post 318/2 on Day 1India vs West Indies, 2nd Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal hit another daddy hundred and remained unbeaten at stumps as India piled on 318 on the opening day. Sai Sudharsan missed out on a hundred by 13 runs, but India dominated the West Indies with the bat once again.

Shardul Thakur captain, Rahane and Sarfaraz in as Mumbai announce Ranji squadShardul Thakur has been named as the new Mumbai captain as the record champions look to claim another title this season. Rahane and Sarfaraz remain as part of the squad, which includes some other big names.
IPL 2026 auction likely in December, retention deadline set for November: ReportThe IPL 2026 mini-auction is likely to be held in mid-December with player retentions due by November.

Mohsin Naqvi meets Pakistan players, motivates them before South Africa TestsPCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi visited Gaddafi Stadium to motivate Pakistan's cricket team ahead of their Test series against South Africa and also met the South African team management.

Rohit trains at Mumbai's Shivaji Park, thousands of fans gather to watch starRohit Sharma hit the nets at Shivaji Park in Mumbai as the former India captain continued his preparations for the upcoming Australia tour. Rohit was seen playing an array of shots as fans cheered him on.

IND vs WI: Sai Sudharsan silences critics with confident 87 in Delhi TestSai Sudharsan silenced critics with a confident 87 in India's second Test against West Indies in New Delhi. His composed innings helped anchor a 193-run partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal, easing pressure on his No. 3 spot.

Asia Cup still in Dubai, PCB chief says no trophy handover without his nodThe Asia Cup trophy, refused by India from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi after their win over Pakistan, remains locked at the ACC Dubai office with instructions that it cannot be handed over without his personal approval.

Kylian Mbappe urges no-probe in Lamine Yamal's personal life: He's just 18Kylian Mbappe has defended Barcelona's Lamine Yamal, urging fans and media to stop scrutinising his personal life. The Real Madrid star emphasised that at 18, Yamal's focus should remain on football and growth.

Rohit trains at Mumbai's Shivaji Park, thousands of fans gather to watch starRohit Sharma hit the nets at Shivaji Park in Mumbai as the former India captain continued his preparations for the upcoming Australia tour. Rohit was seen playing an array of shots as fans cheered him on.

IND vs WI: Sai Sudharsan silences critics with confident 87 in Delhi TestSai Sudharsan silenced critics with a confident 87 in India's second Test against West Indies in New Delhi. His composed innings helped anchor a 193-run partnership with Yashasvi Jaiswal, easing pressure on his No. 3 spot.

Asia Cup still in Dubai, PCB chief says no trophy handover without his nodThe Asia Cup trophy, refused by India from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi after their win over Pakistan, remains locked at the ACC Dubai office with instructions that it cannot be handed over without his personal approval.

Kylian Mbappe urges no-probe in Lamine Yamal's personal life: He's just 18Kylian Mbappe has defended Barcelona's Lamine Yamal, urging fans and media to stop scrutinising his personal life. The Real Madrid star emphasised that at 18, Yamal's focus should remain on football and growth.

WPL 2026 mega auction set for November, RTM to make debut: ReportsThe WPL 2026 mega auction, likely to be held in late November, will mark a major reset for the league, with teams allowed to retain up to five players under a new retention framework. For the first time, franchises will also have access to the RTM option.

From caution to Jas-ball: Yashasvi Jaiswal hits classy century in Delhi Test vs WIYashasvi Jaiswal struck a classy century in New Delhi, shifting gears from a slow start to full Jas-ball mode. His mature knock steadied India's innings and showcased his growing confidence in Test cricket.

Priyansh Arya earns maiden first-class call-up in Delhi squad for Ranji Trophy openerRanji Trophy: Delhi have named a massive 24-member squad for their opening game against Hyderabad. Nitish Rana has been named skipper with Yash Dhull as his deputy.

Nadine de Klerk: The South African storm India never saw coming in VizagWomen's World Cup: In a match crackling with tension and shifting tides, South Africa's Nadine de Klerk delivered a knock for the ages to leave India stunned. Backing her training, her temperament, and her timing, Nadine sealed one of South Africa's most memorable World Cup victories.

Rohit Sharma flaunts his new Tesla, viral video grabs Elon Musk's attentionIndian cricket captain Rohit Sharma drove his new Tesla Model Y to a Mumbai award show, creating a social media sensation. The customised number plate and viral videos attracted Elon Musk's attention.

Hardik Pandya spotted with rumoured girlfriend at Mumbai airport. Video goes viralIndian cricketer Hardik Pandya was spotted with rumoured girlfriend, Mahieka Sharma, at the Mumbai airport recently. The all-rounder has been out of competitive action since the Asia Cup final, which he missed due to an injury.

Pat Cummins in tight spot: Australia wary of skipper's injury risk before AshesAustralia coach Andrew McDonald said the team is closely monitoring Pat Cummins' recovery from a lower-back injury ahead of the Ashes, with the skipper needing to start bowling at least a month before the series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
